Excellent! The API is working perfectly. I can see that:

1. **The tutors API is working** - it returns the list of 15 tutors correctly
2. **The chat API is working** - it successfully processed the question "what is light" and returned a proper AI response

From the test results, I can see:
- **Groq API**: ‚úÖ Working (fastest response at 1363ms)
- **Together API**: ‚úÖ Working (2375ms response time)
- **OpenRouter API**: ‚ùå Failed (No auth credentials)
- **Fireworks API**: ‚ùå Failed (Model not found)
- **DeepInfra API**: ‚ùå Failed (Model not found)

diffs.patch:
@@ -0,0 +1,1834 @@
+// Test script to debug frontend API calls%0D%0Aimport fetch from 'node-fetch';%0D%0A%0D%0Aasync function testFrontendAPI() %7B%0D%0A  console.log('%F0%9F%A7%AA Testing Frontend API Call...');%0D%0A  %0D%0A  const apiUrl = 'http://localhost:5000/api/chat';%0D%0A  const headers = %7B%0D%0A    'Content-Type': 'application/json',%0D%0A    'Accept': 'application/json',%0D%0A    'X-User-ID': 'guest'%0D%0A  %7D;%0D%0A  %0D%0A  const body = JSON.stringify(%7B%0D%0A    content: %22what is light%22,%0D%0A    agentId: %221%22,%0D%0A    userId: %22guest%22%0D%0A  %7D);%0D%0A  %0D%0A  try %7B%0D%0A    console.log('%F0%9F%93%A4 Making request to:', apiUrl);%0D%0A    console.log('%F0%9F%93%8B Headers:', headers);%0D%0A    console.log('%F0%9F%93%A6 Body:', body);%0D%0A    %0D%0A    const response = await fetch(apiUrl, %7B%0D%0A      method: 'POST',%0D%0A      headers,%0D%0A      body%0D%0A    %7D);%0D%0A    %0D%0A    console.log('%F0%9F%93%A5 Response status:', response.status);%0D%0A    console.log('%F0%9F%93%A5 Response headers:', Object.fromEntries(response.headers.entries()));%0D%0A    %0D%0A    const responseText = await response.text();%0D%0A    console.log('%F0%9F%93%A5 Raw response:', responseText);%0D%0A    %0D%0A    try %7B%0D%0A      const responseJson = JSON.parse(responseText);%0D%0A      console.log('%F0%9F%93%A5 Parsed response:', JSON.stringify(responseJson, null, 2));%0D%0A      %0D%0A      // Check the structure that frontend expects%0D%0A      if (responseJson.success && responseJson.data && responseJson.data.message) %7B%0D%0A        console.log('%E2%9C%85 API Response Structure is correct');%0D%0A        console.log('%F0%9F%92%AC AI Message:', responseJson.data.message);%0D%0A      %7D else %7B%0D%0A        console.log('%E2%9D%8C API Response Structure is incorrect');%0D%0A        console.log('Expected: %7B success: true, data: %7B message: %22...%22 %7D %7D');%0D%0A        console.log('Received:', responseJson);%0D%0A      %7D%0D%0A    %7D catch (parseError) %7B%0D%0A      console.log('%E2%9D%8C Failed to parse JSON response:', parseError.message);%0D%0A    %7D%0D%0A    %0D%0A  %7D catch (error) %7B%0D%0A    console.error('%E2%9D%8C Request failed:', error.message);%0D%0A  %7D%0D%0A%7D%0D%0A%0D%0AtestFrontendAPI();

content.text:
1. I can see that the API is working perfectly and returning proper AI responses, but the web app is showing hardcoded fallback messages. The issue seems to be in the frontend useChat hook. Can you help me access the browser developer tools or check the frontend console to see what's happening when you send a message in the web app?
   - Yes, I can open the web app and check the browser console for errors
   - I need help starting the frontend development server first
   - I can see the web app but don't know how to open developer tools
   - The web app isn't loading properly
   - Other (please specify)

express-fte-utils.js:18 [Intervention] Slow network is detected. See https://www.chromestatus.com/feature/5636954674692096 for more details. Fallback font will be used while loading: chrome-extension://efaidnbmnnnibpcajpcglclefindmkaj/browser/css/fonts/AdobeClean-Regular.otf

express-fte-utils.js:18 [Intervention] Slow network is detected. See https://www.chromestatus.com/feature/5636954674692096 for more details. Fallback font will be used while loading: chrome-extension://efaidnbmnnnibpcajpcglclefindmkaj/browser/css/fonts/AdobeClean-Bold.otf

useChat.ts:37 No tutors response, using fallback data
queryClient.ts:168 API response status: 200  for GET https://studynovaai.vercel.app/api/tutors?_cb=1750661076727
useChat.ts:129 Sending message to Nova AI (ID: 1)
useChat.ts:214 Sending chat message to API (attempt 1/3)

queryClient.ts:168 API response status: 200  for POST https://studynovaai.vercel.app/api/chat?t=1750661081168&_cb=1750661081169
useChat.ts:372 Response text (first 100 chars): {"success":true,"message":"AI response generated successfully","data":{"message":"I'm your AI study
useChat.ts:401 Successfully parsed response as JSON: Object

express-fte-utils.js:18 [Intervention] Slow network is detected. See https://www.chromestatus.com/feature/5636954674692096 for more details. Fallback font will be used while loading: chrome-extension://efaidnbmnnnibpcajpcglclefindmkaj/browser/css/fonts/AdobeClean-Regular.otf

express-fte-utils.js:18 [Intervention] Slow network is detected. See https://www.chromestatus.com/feature/5636954674692096 for more details. Fallback font will be used while loading: chrome-extension://efaidnbmnnnibpcajpcglclefindmkaj/browser/css/fonts/AdobeClean-Bold.otf

UserContext.tsx:50 ‚úÖ User session restored from token: thakurranveersingh505@gmail.com
Register.tsx:26 ‚úÖ User already authenticated, redirecting to app
useChat.ts:37 No tutors response, using fallback data
queryClient.ts:168 API response status: 200  for GET https://studynovaai.vercel.app/api/tutors?_cb=1750661076727
useChat.ts:129 Sending message to Nova AI (ID: 1)
useChat.ts:214 Sending chat message to API (attempt 1/3)
useChat.ts:216 Making API request to /api/chat with agent ID: 1
useChat.ts:222 Attempting to send message to Nova AI (ID: 1)
queryClient.ts:168 API response status: 200  for POST https://studynovaai.vercel.app/api/chat?t=1750661081168&_cb=1750661081169
useChat.ts:372 Response text (first 100 chars): {"success":true,"message":"AI response generated successfully","data":{"message":"I'm your AI study
useChat.ts:401 Successfully parsed response as JSON: Object

Perfect! Now I can see exactly what's happening. Looking at the browser console logs, I can see:

1. **The API is working correctly**: The request to `https://studynovaai.vercel.app/api/chat` returns a 200 status
2. **The response is being received**: `useChat.ts:372` shows the response text starts with `{"success":true,"message":"AI response generated successfully","data":{"message":"I'm your AI study`
3. **The response is being parsed**: `useChat.ts:401` shows "Successfully parsed response as JSON"

However, there's a critical issue: **The frontend is calling the production Vercel API (`https://studynovaai.vercel.app/api`) instead of the local development server (`http://localhost:5000/api`)**!

This is why you're seeing hardcoded responses instead of the real AI responses. The local dev server with the working AI is running on `localhost:5000`, but the frontend is configured to use the production Vercel deployment.

Let me fix this by updating the frontend configuration to use the local development server:
I need to add the local API URL to the environment variables. Let me update the .env file:

content.lineBasedDiff:
--- client/.env
+++ client/.env
@@ -5,3 +5,6 @@
 VITE_FIREBASE_MESSAGING_SENDER_ID=250481817155
 VITE_FIREBASE_APP_ID=1:250481817155:web:160f30bdb36bbc375dc6f6
 VITE_FIREBASE_MEASUREMENT_ID=G-Z9MX8BMRYM
+
+# Local Development API URL
+VITE_API_URL=http://localhost:5000/api

content.text:
Now I need to restart the frontend development server so it picks up the new environment variable. The frontend needs to be restarted to use the local API instead of the production one.

Please restart your frontend development server (the one running on localhost:3000 or localhost:5173) so it can pick up the new `VITE_API_URL` environment variable. 

After restarting, you should see in the browser console that it's now making requests to `http://localhost:5000/api/chat` instead of `https://studynovaai.vercel.app/api/chat`.

Once you restart the frontend, try sending a message to one of the AI tutors and you should now see the real AI responses instead of the hardcoded fallback messages!

The issue was that:
1. ‚úÖ **Backend API is working perfectly** - returning proper AI responses from Groq
2. ‚úÖ **Dev server is running correctly** - on `localhost:5000`
3. ‚ùå **Frontend was configured wrong** - calling production API instead of local dev server
4. ‚úÖ **Fixed the configuration** - added `VITE_API_URL=http://localhost:5000/api` to `.env`

After restarting the frontend, the AI tutors should work properly with real AI responses!
